body_content.explanation: the part in the middle of the arm where it bends, or the part of a piece of clothing that covers this area:
examples: Her arm was bandaged from the elbow to the fingers.
The sleeve of his shirt was torn at the elbow.

body_content.explanation: a shape or object that is approximately in the form of a letter L, similar to the shape of a bent arm:
examples: They followed the river up to the point where it formed an elbow towards the southwest.
Use wholegrain pasta of your choice (try elbows or orecchiette).

body_content.explanation: in basketball, one of two points on the court (= playing area) where the free throw line meets with another line at a right angle:
examples: He set up at the elbow and hit a beautiful shot in the final seconds.

body_content.explanation: to push someone rudely with your elbows so that you can move or have more space:
examples: He elbowed his way to the front of the crowd.

body_content.explanation: to hit someone with your elbow, sometimes as a sign to make them notice or remember something:
examples: She elbowed me in the ribs before I could say anything.
The basketball player got elbowed in the face, which was a foul for the other team.
He was sent to the penalty box for elbowing another player.
